result.title: Future climate scenario's: SLR and sea ice extent

result.title: Initial mapping of global climate hotspot areas in WP3-7 contexts
result.description: Initial mapping of global climate hotspot areas, aiming to achieve a balance between representing the most important climate vulnerabilities for each sector, limiting the list of hotspots to a manageable number, and understanding the relationships between different hotspots (e.g. water availability and agricultural drought in the same region). Linked to task 2.2.

result.title: Agro-food Storylines description
result.description: This deliverable presents the storylines describing how the European agro-food economy and food security might be impacted by climate change related to the EU’s global dependency on agricultural products. It will map and assess a selection of key-traded agricultural products and producing regions (outcome of Task 3.1).

result.title: Direct and indirect Economic effects to infrastructure from sea level rise and arctic sea ice extent
result.description: This deliverable describes the effects from SLR scenario and ice extent projection on coastal and regional SLR and sea ice extent on coastal infrastructure and shipping routes, respectively. Each scenario will be assessed using different adaptation options and shows how risk can be reduce by adaptation (Task 7.4).

result.description: This deliverable presents storylines and selects hotspots jointly with WP2 for studying the impacts on European public and private finance caused by climate induced or amplified natural disasters outside the EU and in EU outermost regions and overseas territories.

result.title: Simulation of future storylines under different socio-economic scenarios with Acclimate model
result.description: The simulation of the three future storylines under different socio-economic scenarios is accomplished (task 6.3.2): The three storylines have been projected into the future under different socio-economic assumptions including model-parameter uncertainty. The scientific publication is being prepared.

result.title: Data management plan
result.description: "Developed at the beginning of the project and reviewed periodically. Initial version of DMP; M18,M30,M42: yearly review of DMP. The consortium will look into the ethics and privacy concerns for all data collected and used in the project. The consortium will use the ""How to complete your ethics Self-Assessment"" (http://ec.europa.eu/research/participants/portal/doc/call/h2020/h2020-msca-itn-2015/1620147-h2020_-_guidance_ethics_self_assess_en.pdf) document as a guideline. The DMP will incorporate measures to mitigate ethics and privacy concerns, in particular those related to personal data and data coming from third countries."

result.title: Report on climate change impacts on imported crops in producing regions
result.description: This deliverable presents climate change impacts on crop yields in the selected hotspot locations and assesses the impact of compound events on the EU. It will further consider the EU’s external dependency based on future projections of the EU’s demand, climate suitability, and land and water availability under climate change (outcome of Task 3.3).

result.title: Storylines description
result.description: This deliverable is an internal report describing the storylines and dependencies between impacts to European coastal infrastructure from changes in sea level rise and sea ice extent. The report will be based on an expert workshop, literature review, and the outcome of the kick off meeting (Tasks 7.1 and 7.2), and will qualitatively map both the direct damages to coastal infrastructure and indirect economic effects. In addition, effects from changing sea ice on shipping routes will be assessed.

result.title: Generic internal guidance on storyline development
result.description: A generic internal guidance document on how to construct storylines (including avoiding biases amongst experts, ensuring causality, etc.) based on review storyline development across scientific fields, including physical climate sciences, environmental modelling and other fields. Linked to task 2.1.

result.title: Synthesis report on future risks and adaptation options for building resilience in strategic countries
result.description: Report will synthesize the current and future risks identified throughout Task 5.1-5.4 in the selected partner countries and regions, and rank them based on the perceived importance of the partners’ societal organisation, and explore to what extent the EU external actions on development and humanitarian aid may counteract these threats.
